content.description: Start behind a boulder.  Climb up and trend left to an undercling flake.  From here, use a bomber flake to go straight up to eventually reach a horizontal break with a giant obvious cobble protruding below the break.  Crux is getting to the horizontal break after clipping the bolt below it.  Angle goes to near vertical for the last 40 feet.  This route is super dirty, however the moves are actually quite good throughout.  This thing needs more traffic and perhaps a good scrub down from top to bottom.  It has the potential to be really good.
content.location: Locate the steep routes on the right side of the wall.  This one starts behind a boulder (may be the right most one).  To the right of Unknown glue  job.

content.description: A short dirty route with plenty of loose holds.  Crux is probably getting to the 2nd bolt.  The route trends up and right at each bolt.  Top out on ledge covered in loose cobbles and dirt and clip the anchors.  This route may clean up with more traffic, but its unlikely that star quality is going to increase by much.
content.protection: Bolts.  Anchor is 2 bolts.  Need to walk off.  Easy walk off.  Could be easy access for setting a TR if one desired.
content.location: Left most route on the wall.

content.description: The crux is between the 3rd and 4th bolt. Solid 12a. Powerful sequential moves on steep sandy conglomerate rock at the bottom, technical, vertical, silty pockets up top. Great climbing that needs more ascents to clean up- if people start climbing this route it will become 3 stars quickly. The only down side is the ugly glue job at the start. The route developer started with brown epoxy that matched the rock, and then must have ran out and switched to black epoxy- majorly uncool!
content.protection: Bolts- 10 or so. Chains at top.
content.location: Lccated in Bear Hollow, the north-south running canyon .2 miles west of the Dry Wall. Walk up the double track road 200 feet or so from the entrance to the canyon to the enormous firepit. Catch a trail up and to your right for 30 seconds. You're there man. West facing wall that can be seen from Echo Canyon road.

content.description: This is a very fun route between the easier routes to the left that end with High Planes Drifter, and the harder routes in the cave to the right.  This route ascends mostly vertical rock with one obvious roof at the third bolt where the crux is encountered.  Pull over the roof using good pockets and small crimpy cobbles then continue above with fairly continuous 5.10 climbing to the anchors.
content.location: This route is between the easy routes to the left and the hard routes to the right.  From High Planes Drifter walk about fifty feet right passing one shiny fixe plated bolt until you reach the route with camo'd petzl hangers on wedge bolts.

content.description:
Short route with the crux being the first 3 bolts before it turns from steep to slab. This route is the next set of bolts 4 feet to the left of Maple Jones.

There has been a lot of development at Bear Hollow and plenty of confusion on MP because of it. If anyone has more info on the route I would love to update this.
content.location: There is a steep trail leading up from behind the fire pits. This climb will be directly in front of you at the top of this trail to the left of the bush and above the the big hole in the rock.

content.description: This route follows a line of very closely spaced bolts on the right side of the easier routes on this wall.  There is not really any distinct crux, though  the moves right off the ground are probably the hardest.  Still very dirty, but with traffic this could be a decent beginner route
content.protection: lots and lots of bolts (to the point that you feel like you are doing way more bolt clipping than actual climbing).  I think I counted 10 bolts on this short route.  2 chain anchor.
content.location: This route shares the start with High Planes Drifter and is just to the right of Fist Full of Dollars.  2 routes right of the route with glue-ins, Maple Jones.

climbs.name: Maple Jones
climbs.fa: Jeff Guest and James Garrett, 8 May 2009

content.description:
Excellent cobble climbing for the area, and reminds one of Maple.

Pitch #1: A cruxy, but well protected start climbs past holes, pockets, and solid protruding cobbles passing a smooth upper band to a three bolt belay. 5.9, 15-17m.
content.protection: QDs for 6 black colored glue in bolts
content.location:
This is in Bear Hollow in a north south running canyon just west of the Dry Wall. This West facing wall can be best in the mornings during the hot months.

The parking is just past some shrubbery about 75m north of the frontage road and both it and the climbing offers some seclusion...more so than Dry Wall.

Unfortunately, this seclusion does lend itself to camping by non climbers who have tended to trash the area and shoot up the place. Toilet paper can pretty easily be stowed in a plastic bag and disposed of properly. Please come prepared for lugging out some of the trash and aim to leave it better than you find it. You will be appreciated:)!

From the parking and camping fire pit, walk 1 minute up the short west facing hillside to a blackish water streak of the left wall, it is the only route on the wall (until now) with glue in bolts.

The exact location and GPS for the route is 41° 0'6.16"N, 111°23'31.73"W

content.description:
This route starts up Pale Rider then breaks right at the third bolt.  As with Pale Rider there is no distinct crux, though getting off the ground is probably the most difficult move.

Either clip the third bolt with a long sling or unclip it after clipping the fourth bolt to prevent rope drag.  You could skip the third bolt all together, but you would hit the ground if you came off close to the fourth bolt without clipping the third and it's not that the climbing is hard, but the rock is chossy enough to be worried.

Still quite dirty, but once it cleans up it will be an alright route.
content.protection: lots and lots of bolts, very overbolted like Fist Full of Dollars and Pale Rider.  Eleven bolts to a two chain anchor.
content.location: This shares the start with Pale Rider and branches right at the third bolt.  The start is two routes right of Maple Jones (the route with glue in bolts).

content.description: A fun route just to the right of Maple Jones.  Techy, easy pockets.
content.location: Next route right from Maple Jones.  Starts almost in the bush.

climbs.name: Corn On The Cobble
climbs.fa: Sandro von Känel and James Garrett, April 2013

content.description:
Two routes left of and on the same short wall as Maple Jones. Good Rock all things considering.

Pitch #1: Pockets and cobble your way up to a bulge and lower angle climbing to the belay. 5.10b, 15m.

Matthew Washburn's carabiner left during equipping the original belay had been shot and destroyed by a stray bullet!
content.protection: Glue In bolts to the two bolt belay chains.
content.location:
About 50 feet up canyon and to the left of Maple Jones. Follows a compact stretch of black water streaked rock.

Rappel the route.
